alert.note: Alert for Sedgwick County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 04 at 2:43PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Sedgwick County through 315 PM MDT... At 242 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles southeast of Barton, or 9 miles south of Big Springs, moving west at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Julesburg. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
